alert.note: Alert for Lenawee; Monroe (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 4:48PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Monroe and Lenawee Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 447 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Saline to near Ottawa Lake to near Deshler. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Ottawa Lake around 455 PM EDT. Blissfield around 500 PM EDT. Deerfield around 510 PM EDT. Petersburg around 515 PM EDT. Ida and Britton around 520 PM EDT. Dundee around 525 PM EDT. Maybee around 535 PM EDT. Milan around 540 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Newport, Ogden Center, Erie, Woodland Beach, Stony Point, Ridgeway, Palmyra, Bolles Harbor, Sand Creek and Samaria. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southeastern Michigan.
